title: Develop Without Code Unit | Salesforce Trailhead

questions.title: 1What's the relationship between objects, fields, and records and Salesforce's relational database?

answers.content: B Custom objects are stored in an object-oriented model while standard objects are stored in a relational model
C They're an abstraction of the underlying table structure

wrongAnswers.content: A They're a direct representation of the underlying table structure
D They give you the ability to understand the table structure, but you don't work with them much in Salesforce

correctAnswer.content: C They're an abstraction of the underlying table structure

questions.title: 2How does the metadata-driven architecture support declarative development?

answers.content: A It allows the platform to auto-generate basic components for your org's customizations, like dialogs and forms

wrongAnswers.content: C It gives your users access to more data than they'd have under a different architecture
B It inherently simplifies your org's data model
D It entirely removes the need for programmatic development in Salesforce

correctAnswer.content: A It allows the platform to auto-generate basic components for your org's customizations, like dialogs and forms
